#Text=Congolese refugee death toll climbs
#Text=Saturday , March 29 , 2014
#Text=The Democratic Republic of Congo ( DRC ) government has confirmed that at least 251 Congolese refugees died after their boat capsized on Lake Albert on Saturday , en-route from Uganda .
#Text=NASA satellite image of Lake Albert showing the border between the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda
#Text=Image : Slawojar .
#Text=Spokesman for the government , Lambert Mende , made the statement on Thursday :
#Text=" It is with deep sorrow that we confirm the death of 251 of our compatriots who had boarded the boat from the Ugandan side of Lake Albert " .

column1: #Text=It is with deep sorrow that we confirm the death of 251 of our compatriots who had boarded the boat from the Ugandan side of Lake Albert . — Lambert Mende
#Text=President Joseph Kabila declared three days of national mourning , which began on Thursday , described by Mende as a display of compassion and solidarity with the people of Congo .
#Text=The refugees were reportedly returning to the DRC , leaving Uganda voluntarily .

#Text=Mende has claimed this is due to the " poor quality of welcome to which they were subjected , " while the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees ( UNHCR ) has recently recorded an increase in Congolese refugees spontaneously returning to the DRC , following a military victory over rebels in the nation 's east last November .
#Text=Tragedy struck the overcrowded vessel , when , as latest reports claim , it was carrying around three hundred people .
#Text=Two boats were attempting to cross Lake Albert from the Hoima district on the Ugandan shore .

#Text=The waterway is known to be dangerous when the weather is rough , and combined with a lack of life-jackets and a general inability of passengers to swim , incidents like this often lead to high body counts .
#Text=Days before , a campaign had been launched by the DRC to enforce wearing lifejackets aboard all vessels in the nation ’s waterways .
#Text=Since Saturday , the death toll has continued to climb , it was initially reported that twenty had died .
#Text=On Monday , UNHCR received information from authorities that 41 people had been rescued and 98 bodies recovered .
#Text=This number climbed again by Tuesday – with reports stating 107 had died , including 57 children .
#Text=The survivors were taken to the Bundibugyo district , in the north-west of Uganda , where UNHCR and the Ugandan government are providing help , including psycho-social support .
#Text=Relatives of the deceased are identifying family members at the district hospital .
#Text=UNHCR and the Ugandan government are assisting in the transport of the bodies back to the DRC , and have established an information and response point for relatives of the survivors .
#Text=Julian Paluku , governor of the North Kivu district has said the recovery of bodies will continue .
#Text=Reportedly , the refugees had originally fled the DRC after a July 2013 attack on the Kamango region to the east-northeast of the capital , Kinshasa .
